trans-unit.source: Track and revoke your documents when you use the RMS sharing application
trans-unit.target: Track and revoke your documents when you use the RMS sharing application

trans-unit.source: After you have protected your documents by using the RMS sharing application, if your organization is using Azure Rights Management rather than Active Directory Rights Management Services, you can track how people are using your protected documents.
trans-unit.target: After you have protected your documents by using the RMS sharing application, if your organization is using Azure Rights Management rather than Active Directory Rights Management Services, you can track how people are using your protected documents.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, you can also revoke access to these documents when you want to stop sharing them.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, you can also revoke access to these documents when you want to stop sharing them.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you use the document tracking site, which you can access from Windows computers, Mac computers, and even from tablets and phones.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you use the document tracking site, which you can access from Windows computers, Mac computers, and even from tablets and phones.

trans-unit.source: Two minute video: <link><linkText>Azure RMS Document Tracking and Revocation</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: Two minute video: <link><linkText>Azure RMS Document Tracking and Revocation</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: When you access this site, sign in to track your documents.
trans-unit.target: When you access this site, sign in to track your documents.

trans-unit.source: Providing your organization has a <link><linkText>subscription that supports document tracking and revocation</linkText><title></title></link> and you are assigned a license for this subscription, you can then see who tried to open the files that you protected and whether they were successful (they were successfully authenticated) or not.
trans-unit.target: Providing your organization has a <link><linkText>subscription that supports document tracking and revocation</linkText><title></title></link> and you are assigned a license for this subscription, you can then see who tried to open the files that you protected and whether they were successful (they were successfully authenticated) or not.

trans-unit.source: Each time they tried to access the document, and their location at the time.
trans-unit.target: Each time they tried to access the document, and their location at the time.

trans-unit.source: In addition:
trans-unit.target: In addition:

trans-unit.source: If you need to stop sharing a document: Click Revoke access, note the period of time that the document will continue to be available, and decide whether to let people know that you’re revoking access to the document you previously shared, and provide a customized message.
trans-unit.target: If you need to stop sharing a document: Click Revoke access, note the period of time that the document will continue to be available, and decide whether to let people know that you’re revoking access to the document you previously shared, and provide a customized message.

trans-unit.source: If you want to export to Excel: Click Open in Excel, so that you can then modify the data, and create your own views and graphs.
trans-unit.target: If you want to export to Excel: Click Open in Excel, so that you can then modify the data, and create your own views and graphs.

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure email notifications: Click Settings and select how and whether to be emailed when the document is accessed.
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure email notifications: Click Settings and select how and whether to be emailed when the document is accessed.

trans-unit.source: If you have questions or want to provide feedback about the document tracking site: Click the Help icon to access the <link><linkText>FAQ for Document Tracking</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have questions or want to provide feedback about the document tracking site: Click the Help icon to access the <link><linkText>FAQ for Document Tracking</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Using Office to access the document tracking site
trans-unit.target: Using Office to access the document tracking site

trans-unit.source: For the Office applications, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint: On the Home tab, in the RMS group, click Share Protected, and then click Track Usage.
trans-unit.target: For the Office applications, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint: On the Home tab, in the RMS group, click Share Protected, and then click Track Usage.

trans-unit.source: For Outlook: On the Home tab, in the RMS group, click Track Usage:
trans-unit.target: For Outlook: On the Home tab, in the RMS group, click Track Usage:

trans-unit.source: If you do not see these options for RMS, it’s likely that either the RMS sharing application is not installed on your computer, the latest version isn’t installed, or your computer must be restarted to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see these options for RMS, it’s likely that either the RMS sharing application is not installed on your computer, the latest version isn’t installed, or your computer must be restarted to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to install the sharing application, see <link><linkText>Download and install the Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to install the sharing application, see <link><linkText>Download and install the Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Other ways to track and revoke your documents
trans-unit.target: Other ways to track and revoke your documents

trans-unit.source: In addition to tracking your documents on Windows computers by using Office applications, you can also use these alternatives:
trans-unit.target: In addition to tracking your documents on Windows computers by using Office applications, you can also use these alternatives:

trans-unit.source: Using a web browser: This method works for all supported devices.
trans-unit.target: Using a web browser: This method works for all supported devices.

trans-unit.source: Using File Explorer: This method works for Windows computers.
trans-unit.target: Using File Explorer: This method works for Windows computers.

trans-unit.source: Using an Outlook email message: This method works for Windows computers.
trans-unit.target: Using an Outlook email message: This method works for Windows computers.

trans-unit.source: Using a web browser to access the doc tracking site
trans-unit.target: Using a web browser to access the doc tracking site

trans-unit.source: Using a supported browser, go to the <link><linkText>document tracking site</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Using a supported browser, go to the <link><linkText>document tracking site</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported browsers: We recommend using Internet Explorer that is at least version 10, but you can use any of following browsers to use the document tracking site:
trans-unit.target: Supported browsers: We recommend using Internet Explorer that is at least version 10, but you can use any of following browsers to use the document tracking site:

trans-unit.source: Internet Explorer: At least version 10
trans-unit.target: Internet Explorer: At least version 10

trans-unit.source: Internet Explorer 9 with at least MS12-037: Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer: June 12, 2012
trans-unit.target: Internet Explorer 9 with at least MS12-037: Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer: June 12, 2012

trans-unit.source: Mozilla Firefox: At least version 12
trans-unit.target: Mozilla Firefox: At least version 12

trans-unit.source: Apple Safari 5: At least version 5
trans-unit.target: Apple Safari 5: At least version 5

trans-unit.source: Google Chrome: At least version 18
trans-unit.target: Google Chrome: At least version 18

trans-unit.source: Using File Explorer to access the doc tracking site
trans-unit.target: Using File Explorer to access the doc tracking site

trans-unit.source: Right-click the file, select Protect with RMS, and then select Track Usage:
trans-unit.target: Right-click the file, select Protect with RMS, and then select Track Usage:

trans-unit.source: Using an Outlook email message to access the doc tracking site
trans-unit.target: Using an Outlook email message to access the doc tracking site

trans-unit.source: In an email message, in the Message tab, in the RMS group, click Share Protected, and then click Track Usage:
trans-unit.target: In an email message, in the Message tab, in the RMS group, click Share Protected, and then click Track Usage:

trans-unit.target: Examples and other instructions
